name: Identifier
description: An identifier for an entity (possibly other things, e.g. securities in the future). Examples are tax IDs, non-profit IDs, SEC CIK numbers, Federal Reserve RSSD id. The main requirements for an identifier is that they should be well-defined, and issued by a government or have statutory standing

identifier_system_code.description: An identifier representing the identifier system. Some examples of this are us_fein (US Federal tax number), us_sec_cik (US Securities and Exchange Commission CIK), gb_ew_cc (Charity Commission of England & Wales), lei (Global Legal Entity Identifier Scheme). For a current list see http://api.opencorporates.com/identifier_systems
